textos_fuente.text: Ferndale Irish pub, Rosie O'Grady's closed down Sunday night News Sports Autos Entertainment Advertise Obituaries eNewspaper Legals OAKLAND Rosie O'Grady's in downtown Ferndale closes its doors for good Minnah Arshad Detroit Free Press Downtown Ferndale bid farewell to decades-old Irish pub, Rosie O’Grady’s, Sunday night. The closure was announced on Facebook Saturday night, hours before the store’s last day in business, writing that it was “mostly due in part to ongoing staffing shortages.” “It's been a good ride and unfortunately, tomorrow, June 27, will be Rosie’s Last Call,” the Facebook post read. The restaurant could not be reached for comment. As first reported by Eater, this shutdown came two months after Hometown Restaurant Group, which owns Rosie O’Grady’s, bought Public House and Antihero. Over the weekend, Rosie O’Grady’s final post saw more than 200 comments, ranging from despair at the closure to frustration for the late notice to staff and customers. This came a few months after the same owners were accused of pulling a publicity stunt for One-Eyed Betty’s, when they announced a temporary closing for renovations that led people to believe the closure was permanent. More: Ferndale's One-Eyed Betty's renovation closure triggers a firestorm of angry comments Highland Park: Red Hots Coney Island in Highland Park to close doors after 100 years in business At the end of the farewell post, Rosie O’Grady’s said they were working on a space at 9 Mile Road and Allen Street. Contact Minnah Arshad: MArshad@freepress.com and follow her on Twitter @minnaharshad. Support local journalism here . About Grady's Cold Brew Grady’s Cold Brew is a New Orleans–Style coffee concentrate. We cold brew a special blend of coffee, chicory, and spices for 20 hours,  resulting in a velvety-smooth cup with every pour. Sip it straight, water it down, or milk it for all it's worth. Cheers!
